intro: Polygonum persicaria var. vulgare, commonly known as common knotgrass, is a flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 60–120 cm. The plant features triangular, smooth, and often reddish stems with alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. It is native to Europe and Asia but has been naturalized in many parts of the world.
